scope: Acquisition, retention, analytics and ops. Excludes core product R&D.

categories.name: Strategy & Use-Case Selection
categories.definition: Decide where AI creates net value within marketing.

subcategories.name: Opportunity Sizing
subcategories.purpose: Estimate impact and effort of candidate use-cases.

subcategories.name: Pilot Design
subcategories.purpose: Define MVP scope, metrics and success thresholds.

categories.name: Acquisition & Growth
categories.definition: Drive qualified demand using AI-augmented channels.

subcategories.name: Predictive Targeting
subcategories.purpose: Propensity modelling for paid and email.

subcategories.name: Content Automation
subcategories.purpose: Brief-to-draft workflows for ads, blogs and assets.

subcategories.name: SEO Automation
subcategories.purpose: Entity mapping, internal linking, technical checks.

categories.name: Retention & Lifecycle
categories.definition: Increase LTV via personalisation and automation.

subcategories.name: Next-Best-Action
subcategories.purpose: Trigger offers and nudges per user state.

subcategories.name: Churn Prediction
subcategories.purpose: Flag at-risk accounts for save plays.

categories.name: Data & Measurement
categories.definition: Collect, model and attribute outcomes safely.

subcategories.name: Model Ops
subcategories.purpose: Evaluation, cost control and fallback plans.

subcategories.name: Security & Privacy
subcategories.purpose: PII handling, consent logs, vendor checks.

distinctness_notes.reason: Distinct lifecycle objectives and KPIs (new pipeline vs LTV).

edge_cases: Content Automation could sit under Ops; kept under Acquisition for demand impact.
Support Automation overlaps CS; kept in Retention due to LTV linkage.

mece_confirmation.mutually_exclusive_because: Each category maps to a distinct mission with unique KPIs and owners.
mece_confirmation.collectively_exhaustive_because: Together they cover selection, execution across lifecycle, measurement and scale/control.
